titleStmt.title: By the Quene. The Quenes maiestie considering howe necessary it is and pleasynge to almyghtye God, to haue concorde and peace with al princes ... hath therefore ... passed, concluded and agreed, a good, perfect, syncere and perpetuall amitie, peace ... betwene hir most excellent Maiestie ... and the ryght high and mighty Prince Henry the French Kyng ...
Proclamations. 1558-04-07
titleStmt.author: England and Wales. Sovereign (1558-1603 : Elizabeth I)

publicationStmt.publisher: In Poules Churcheyarde, bi Richarde Iugge, and Iohn Cavvood, Printers to the Quenes Maiestie,

notesStmt.note: A proclamation of peace between England, France and Scotland.
Another edition of STC 7892 (Steele, R. Tudor and Stuart Proclamations, 504).
At foot of page: Cum priuilegio Regiæ Maiestatis.
Last complete line of text ends: "Ire-".
Reproduction of the original in the Bodleian Library.
